attributes.action: The Most Illustrious Order of Saint Patrick
attributes.additional_details:
Why should the Order Of Chivalry of the British Irish territories stop awarding accolades to it's Irish citizens simply because we conceded a portion of that territory? We should not punish the citizens of Northern Ireland who truly act in chivalric ways for the greater good. Scotland have the Order of the Thistle, The Kingdom of England and Wales have the Garter, let Northern Ireland have St Patrick.

This is a call for a more active role of the Order, with it's last award being delegated in 1936 and it's last member dying in 1974 with Prince Henry. Please help us keep this noble order alive.
